info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 9:20AM CDT until June 1 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama...
Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Clarke, Washington and Choctaw Counties.
Tombigbee River Near Leroy affecting Clarke and Washington Counties.
For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Coffeeville Dam - Pool, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tombigbee River near Coffeeville Dam.
* WHEN...Until Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 29.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CDT Thursday was 29.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.8 feet on 02/09/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued when updates occur.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Choctaw, AL; Clarke, AL; Washington, AL
